720899f-b.title: Manhattan: Leroy Street - 7th Avenue South
720899f-b.text:
No. 1
68-64 Leroy Street, south side, west of Seventh Avenue South,
seen from St. Luke's Place and showing at the right a portion of
Hudson Park. 68-66 Leroy Street, the low building adjoining the
eastern side of the park, is the Hudson Park Library, a branch of
the New York Public Library. The eastern side of the building
exactly marks the old eastern boundary of the Trinity Church Farm,
which was originally one of the Dutch farms confiscated by the Duke
of York, and was deeded in perpetuity to Trinity Church by Queen Anne.
May 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
No. 2
A view solely of the Hudson ark Library during imrovemment
by the (orks trogress Administration. This agency also constructed
a swimming pool in the easterly portion of the Park that adjoins
this structure. During same, several gruesome objects were
recovered, as this was formerly St. Johns Cemetery.
January 19, 1937
Vorks Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
Credit Line Imperative
720899f-b.folder: Leroy Street & 7th Avenue South, Manhattan, NY

709624f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue South, east side, north of Le Roy Street.
March 6, 1929.

709624f-a.folder: 7th Avenue South & Leroy Street, Manhattan, NY

720897f-a.title: Manhattan: Leroy Street - Bedford Street
720897f-a.text:
(1)
Leroy Street, eastern section (formerly Burton Street), north side,
east from and including Bedford Street and Seventh Avenue South.
46 Bedford Street, the old frame house at the corner, and 29
Leroy Street adjoining it, are to be demolished before 1935.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 361.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A closer view at a later date.
May 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720897f-a.folder: Leroy Street & Bedford Street, Manhattan, NY

720898f-a.title: Manhattan: Leroy Street - Bedford Street
720898f-a.text:
Leroy Street, south side, at Bedford Street, as photographed
from the west side of Seventh Avenue Extension and across ssme.
Thru the center runs Bedford Street to continue its southeasterly
course to Sixth Avenue at Houston Street.
May 7, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

720895f-b.title: Manhattan: Leroy Street - 7th Avenue South
720895f-b.text:
Leroy Street, eastern section (formerly Burton Street), east from
and including Seventh Avenue South and Bedford Street. 46 Bef
Street, on the N.E. corner of Leroy Stneet, is an old frame hou
faced with brick, which is to be demolished the year after this
photograph was taken. 48 Bedford Street, the five-story house
adjoining it, had its northwest corner trimned in 1914 when
Seventh Avenue South was cut through and now has a Seventh Aven
South address.
May 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Leroy Street,east of Seventh Avenue. Note that~46 Pedford 5tr
hns heen demolished and a new building erected.
April I3th,I940
P.L.Snerr,
NO RIPRODICTI3E.
